result.execSummary:
The defendant Alan G Hamilton #510864 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: for the 4/20/06 Sentencing Hearing on Revocation filed by Court Reporter Dorothy Campbell
written outline of defendant's criminal record filed by DA Kohlwey

Case called at 1:10 p.m., Defendant Alan G Hamilton  #510864 in court, in custody with attorney Margaret Andrea Waterman.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing recommendation put on record. Statements by attorneys and defendant. Court sentenced defendant on count 1 to 2 yr. prison, consisting of 1 year confinement and 1 year extended supervision. Court sentenced defendant on count 2 to 2 yr. prison, consisting of 1 year confinement and 1 year extended supervision.  Court sentenced defendant on count 3 to 2 yr. prison, consisting of 1 year confinement and 1 year extended supervision, counts consecutive to each other and consecutive to sentence currently serving. Conditions of extended supervision:    Maintain absolute sobriety.   Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations or continue program established while incarcerated. Complete psychological evaluation and treatment or continue treatment already getting while incarcerated.  Civil judgment entered for unpaid financials.  Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Academy, is eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Court granted 67 days jail credit.  Court adjourned at 1:41 p.m.
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus to New Lisbon Correctional Institution for 11-17-15 at 1:00 pm.
